result.execSummary:
The defendant Amherst Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Illinois where the Deft lives and works.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - fine pd in full.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay fine of $300.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Sherry Boachie, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amherst Powell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Rec'd check #16CH075559 back from USPS - "Insufficient Address"
Bond applied; partial refund;   kmk/cp    ck#16CH075559
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge  kmk

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared without counsel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. waived his right to counsel.  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentenced to serve 30 days in Co. Jail; sentence stayed, placed on probation for one year w/conditions.  Probation may be transferred to Illinois, where def. lives and works.  Cash bond to apply to fine & costs due; balance to be returned to poster.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk

Continued Posted
  *No Contact w/ Sherry B or her residence.
947.012(1)(a) Telephone Harassment

228/237 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Daniel Tombasco    Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clk  Janell Thwing.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.   Not Guilty by the court.  Deft demands jury trial. Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 02:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 09:00 am. $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
DE posted and was given court date of 10-15-15.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA J Krejcarek.
and witness list filed by the State
